intro: Sparganophorus ageratoides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features silver-gray, fuzzy foliage and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The botanical features of Sparganophorus ageratoides make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
